detailsOfAchievement: The project works with female sex workers of Dibrugarh District. The project identifies women engaged in sex work and stress done works to raise their standard of living by promoting behaviour change; to provide treatment for STI and to explain the measures for preventing the spread. Family Counselling Centre supported by Assam State Social Welfare Board: The centre is provide active services in issues related to Domestic violence , on many womenâ€™s issues arising from domestic abuse, family disturbed due to alcoholism, drug addiction etc. Services ranging from counseling, the centre also provides education and outreach, giving provisions, and mobilizing and organizing activism. The main goal continues to be to improve the relationship of each family member to the others, so that the family progressed as a harmonious unit. Creche Centre supported by Assam State Social Welfare Board under Rajiv Gandhi National CrÃ¨che Scheme: Total 100 children enrolled at the centres. Through this centres working women were specially benefited. Nutrition support also provide to the children. 8 nos. Ayas appointed in four centres. SEWA KARMI self running progrmme : Through this welfare programme SEWA will provide companion to old age people, aged person who lived without any family companion, sick people who needs a competent care giver. SEWA workers will provide support to these needy people not only companion but also Para medical support, psychological support, house keeping, maintain health records & coordinating, counseling, food preparation etc. Implementing Resettlement Plan supported by FREMAA Assistant General Secretary: SEWA is engaged by Assam Integrated Flood and River Erosion Risk Mitigation Agency as consultant to implement the Resettlement Plan at Dibrugarh Sub Project Area, Some of the key roles and responsibilities of SEWA as implementing RP are : Closely working with affected community and disseminate information to ensure correct and complete information is available to affected households, To undertake verification of census data. To take lead responsibility in planning and implementing the livelihood activities under the RP To ensure gender sensitivity and to safeguard interest of poor and marginalized. Disaster Preparedness Programme: The curriculum for an awareness programme has been designed by SEWA, which is implemented in Dibrugarh urban and periphery villages, to equip the people to face and overcome natural disasters easily. SEWA with the help of Dibrugarh Municipal Board would take up a massive awareness campaign through out the Municipal Board jurisdiction for preparedness through rallies, awareness meeting, different competitions like essay, debate, drawing etc. among SHGs members, school students, explaining Doâ€™s and Donâ€™ts of various disasters, showing the safe shelters and safe routes for evacuation, flood preparedness etc.

detailsOfAchievement: sSTEP â€œSociety for Social Transformation and Environment Protectionâ€ (sSTEP) is a Right based, humanitarian development organization working with the poor and marginalized communities of Guwahati Urban and also rural part of Assam. The organization was formed by a pool of young city based volunteers deeply concerned about the distressful conditions that the growing communities of urban poor are in. Initially a loose informal network of friends and volunteers, it coalesced together as a group and started working as a unit from 1998, but it was formally registered under the Societies Registration Act of 1860 in the year 2001. The group emerged, when as contemporaries studying together in the Gauhati University with a deep commitment to work for the poor in Assam, they came forward to work as volunteers for organizations and agencies working for the deprived. In course of their work, having trained themselves with the support of different organizations and agencies, they were able to visit and live with the most remotely located and impoverished communities across the state.

detailsOfAchievement: The critical focus of SRC Dispur is giving technical and Resource support to the adult education Program . For that, SRC Dispur endeavor to create an environment for non literates to continue their learning in literacy classes. SRC Dispur conduct some basic literacy classes to support SLMA in four SBM Districts. Till date 7000 non literate are adopted by SRC Dispur and made literate and certified by NIOS. During this Financial Year 1580 are enrolled under SRC Dispur. The intervention in SAGY villages are creating awareness, convergence with PRI and to all Voluntary Teachers and preroks of SAGY Villages, timely support of some TLM to learners and constant monitoring and support for 100% literacy. Achieved 68.35% literacy in SAGY Villages. Out of 12384 non literates identified in SAGY, 8465 have declared passed by NIOS upto march 2016 and others are going to appear in the next NIOS to make 100% literacy in SAGY Villages. SRC Dispur has established and strengthen eight AEC as model for others. The prime concern of SRC Dispur is to do some Action research on issues of literacy and it is our great achievement that we have completed two of our action research work during FY 2015-16 named â€œIdentification of Local dialects and possibility of developing special primer on each dialectâ€ and â€œRole and Responsibilities of PRI functionaries in SBM ( A critical analysis of practical implementation of the concept with special reference to Dhuburi district)â€. Another major achievement of SRC Dispur is that development and production of resource books of social issues of witch hunting, women violence, women health. Two graded material of three in each subject named â€œHealthâ€ and â€œSwatchataâ€. Translation of Handbooks for preraks on IPMC developed by NLMA was also done during 2015-16 FY A series of training programmes for its functionaries and also for district level and block lever coordinators have been organized to capacitated them in the literacy/empowerment process. Publication of annual report and newsletter one in English and one in Assamese are also regularly publishing by SRC Dispur. Assamese Newsletter is for neo literates to continue learning. Translation of equivalency primer in Bengali medium for open basic literacy is also one of the great achievement of SRC Dispur.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Tejimola is a folk tale of Assam written by Rasaraj Lakshminath Bezbarua. A merchant has two wives and a daughter Tejimola by his first wife. When the elder wife dies her stepmother is put in charge of the girl. The merchant goes abroad. Tejimola desires to attend her friend’s marriage. Her stepmother gives her a bundle of clothes to be put on near her friend’s house. As she opens the bundle,Tejimola finds there a mouse and cinders and the cloths all spoiled. Road puppet use in Puppet drama.

Srimanta Sankardeva’s creation, Ram Vijay Bhaona is never performed by puppets. Surojit Academy chose to work on Ram Vijay Bhaona by puppet as experiment and to give a new taste to the audience. Another main objective of this show was to show the involvement of children to old age groups of people. The puppetry artist age ranged from 12 to 50 years.
